DataElement.preferredName: No Specimen Blocks Slide Submission Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text reason that slides or paraffin blocks are not able to be submitted for review and evaluation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a preserved bit of tissue or blood or urine submitted for research purposes on block or slide._The non-affirmative response to a question.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Blocks; refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.:A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.:Submission; a message submitted for the judgment of others.

Concepts.definition: Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.
A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.
Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The non-affirmative response to a question._Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Associated concept to VM for TCGA. mc 11/9/12 - reversed concept order to match the semantics of this phrase which is "other" with "specify" as a qualifier/modifier - DW 12-30-2015

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
